Plot Method for 'plot.rma.uni.selmodel' Objects

plot.rma.uni.selmodel.Rd

Plot method for objects of class "plot.rma.uni.selmodel". 

# S3 method for rma.uni.selmodel
plot(x, xlim, n=1001, prec="max",
      scale=FALSE, rug=TRUE, add=FALSE, lwd=2, ...)

Arguments

x

an object of class "rma.uni".
xlim

x-axis limits. Essentially the range of p-values for which the selection function should be plotted. If unspecified, the function sets limits automatically.
n

numerical value indicating for how many p-values within the x-axis limits the function value should be computed.
prec

either a character string (with options "max", "min", "mean", or "median") or a numeric value.
scale

logical specifying whether the function values should be rescaled to a 0 to 1 range (the default is FALSE).
rug

logical specifying whether the observed p-values should be added as tick marks on the x-axis (the default is TRUE).
add

logical specifying whether the function should be added to an existing plot (the default is FALSE).
lwd

numerical value for the line width.
...

other arguments.

Details

Blah.

Author

Wolfgang Viechtbauer wvb@metafor-project.org http://www.metafor-project.org

References

Viechtbauer, W. (2010). Conducting meta-analyses in R with the metafor package. Journal of Statistical Software, 36(3), 1--48. https://doi.org/10.18637/jss.v036.i03

See also

selmodel.rma.uni

Examples

### copy data into 'dat' and examine data
dat <- dat.hackshaw1998

### random-effects model using the log odds ratios
res <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat, method="ML")
res

#> 
#> Random-Effects Model (k = 37; tau^2 estimator: ML)
#> 
#> tau^2 (estimated amount of total heterogeneity): 0.0204 (SE = 0.0165)
#> tau (square root of estimated tau^2 value):      0.1427
#> I^2 (total heterogeneity / total variability):   27.62%
#> H^2 (total variability / sampling variability):  1.38
#> 
#> Test for Heterogeneity:
#> Q(df = 36) = 47.4979, p-val = 0.0952
#> 
#> Model Results:
#> 
#> estimate      se    zval    pval   ci.lb   ci.ub 
#>   0.2171  0.0486  4.4712  <.0001  0.1219  0.3123  *** 
#> 
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 ‘***’ 0.001 ‘**’ 0.01 ‘*’ 0.05 ‘.’ 0.1 ‘ ’ 1
#> 

### fit step selection model
sel <- selmodel(res, type="stepfun", steps=c(0.05, 0.10, 0.50, 1.00))

### plot selection function
plot(sel, scale=TRUE)


### fit negative exponential selection model
sel <- selmodel(res, type="negexp")

### add selection function to the existing plot
plot(sel, add=TRUE, col="blue")
